## The Lamb Language

#### Dependencies

This project depends on third party libraries to work correctly. Please go [here](https://github.com/Sornaensis/COP-4020#packages) to get them.

#### About

Lambda expression language parser/evaluator written in haskell with Parsec. The internal language representation is based on one of the factorial programs taken from [this page](http://www.willamette.edu/~fruehr/haskell/evolution.html) that implemented a simple interpreted language to represent the factorial function. I used another one in the file [factorial.ls](factorial.ls) as an example program.

Everything is written as lambda expressions but you can bind these expressions to names in the `REPL`

```
λ> (\f g x -> f x g) (\x y -> x) 5 (+)
5
λ> let compose = \f g x -> f (g x)
λ> compose (*3) (+2) 4
18
```

All function application is left-associative prefix. Infix expression parsing is on the `TODO` list!

A file full of let-expressions can be loaded with `:l`, and file paths can be completed from the input
```
λ> :l fac<TAB>  -- press TAB to complete
λ> :l factorial.ls
```

#### Building

Within your favorite `$shell` (or cmd.exe if you are on windows)

```
$ cd lamba-language/
$ ghc -o lamb Main.hs
```

#### Invocation
```
$ ./lamb
```

Example `REPL` session
```
λλλ Lambda Language REPL. λλλ
Type 'quit' to exit.
λ> :l factorial.ls
λ> fac 600
 
λ> quit
```
